snippet: The federal government is still enrolling some critically ill people in clinical trials, but the pace has slowed dramatically and many sick people will have to wait for treatment.
abstract: Federal government is still enrolling some critically ill people in clinical trials at the National Institutes of Health during the government shutdown, but the pace has slowed drastically and many other sick people are having to wait for treatment.

byline.contributor: Denise Grady contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The federal government is still enrolling some critically ill people in clinical trials, but the pace has slowed dramatically and many sick people will have to wait for treatment.

headline.main: Clinical Trials Continue, but Only at a Crawl
headline.print_headline: Clinical Trials Continue, but Only at a Crawl

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
